DOC.HEAD: Desert Area Jolted by 4.2 Quake
DOC.TEXT: A moderate earthquake rattled this desert town. No major damage or injuries were reported, authorities said. The quake struck at 10:27 p.m. Sunday and measured 4.2 on the Richter scale, said Robert Finn, a spokesman for the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena. It was centered nine miles east-northeast of Indio, a community 125 miles east of Los Angeles. ``We had several calls from people inquiring if this was an earthquake, but we haven't had any reports of damage or injury or anything like that,'' said Kathleen Murray, a police dispatcher. The Richter scale is a gauge of the energy released by an earthquake, as measured by the ground motion recorded on a seismograph. An earthquake of 3.5 on the Richter scale can cause slight damage in the local area, 4 moderate damage, 5 considerable damage.
